Articles.Content:
This suggestion will be about thruster failures. I think that this addition would add more challenge to Kerbal Space Program. This could usually happen after launch in Kerbin's atmosphere or by entering another atmosphere (Laythe, Eve, Duna, Etc.) or by re-entering Kerbin's atmosphere. Of course, this won't be a common thing. It would be extremely rare, like maybe 2.35% chance or lower, so you wouldn't have to worry as much as you think you do. I think that this will add a slightly more bit of realism into the game. Some may not like the idea, plummeting into the ground when your one thruster failed, spinning out of control because 1 out of 3 thrusters failed. Listen though, wouldn't it be funny to tell you friends "Um yah, my rocket crashed into Luna because my thruster failed." Besides that, there must be a lot of things in Kerbal Space Program that you may not like it right after it happened, but your glad that its in the game.

Thank you for reading, and I would appreciate your feedback. It's good to know what people like

Thank you for your service today.

Please see the Sticky thread at the top of the forum - "What not to suggest". Random failure is one of them!

Random failures won't be put in the game. The reasoning is that this rarely improves interest value, but but frequently causes undue frustration. All failures will be due to player error.

Please don't be discouraged, there is plenty of room for suggestions, just be careful to check the stickies before making your.

Many Thanks!
